thread.title: Oops! Amal Clooney Suffers Malfunction At First Wedding Annivesary Celebrations
thread.title_full: Oops! Amal Clooney Suffers Malfunction At First Wedding Annivesary Celebrations

title: Oops! Amal Clooney Suffers Malfunction At First Wedding Annivesary Celebrations
text:
Receive all updates via Facebook. Just Click the Like Button Below Don't ask Again 
Amal Clooney celebrated her first (extended) wedding anniversary with husband, George Clooney in London's Notting Hill. 
The 37-year-old barrister looked gorgeous in a floral print Dolce and Gabbana dress which was teamed up with a red trench coat. However, the star wife showed rather more than she intended while getting into her car post first anniversary dinner celebrations. 
After stepping into her car, Amal's trench coat and dress moved and showed her sheer stockings and a little more than she intended. 
Images Courtesy of Infinity Pix 
Amal and George got married on September 27 last year and went out for a belated anniversary dinner on Saturday night. The star couple later partied with Matt Damon and former model Cindy Crawford at the Electric Cinema in London's Notting Hill. 
Image Courtesy of Jesal/Tanna/Splash News/Twitter 
A week before, George Clooney spoke about his first wedding anniversary . The couple reportedly kept it low profile and very much intimately private with a dinner together. 
The 54-year-old hunk told Extra 's AJ Calloway that he was taking a low-key approach to the couple's first anniversary. He also joked that there was no need for fireworks as they will celebrate many more anniversaries together. "We had our first-year anniversary two nights ago," Clooney said while at a screening of his cult film 'O Brother, Where Art Thou?' at The New York Film Festival on Tuesday night. 
"I had to start off by (going to) a Jerry Weintraub event... and then afterwards she and I got to sneak out and have a dinner,' he told Extra. 
Host AJ teased Clooney, "That was it, just a little dinner?" "What are you gonna do, shoot off fireworks?", Clooney joked. "You know, sometimes you just go to dinner," he simply said. "This is the paper anniversary you don't want to go too crazy on the first, you know, you've got a lot more to do," he said.
